p: Abnormalities in lipid profiles are common complications in diabetes mellitus. In addition to its anti-hyperglycemic effect, an aqueous fraction of B. abyssinica was also able to alter the levels of serum lipid levels such as TC, TG, HDL, VLDL, and LDL cholesterol levels in diabetic mice suggesting a remarkable anti-hyperlipidemic effect. The serum lipid levels are typically raised in diabetic patients and such increments indicate a risk factor for CHD. 55 Activation of hormone-sensitive lipase during insulin deficiency causes an increase in free fatty acid mobilization from adipose tissue. In addition, hyperglycemia is accompanied by a rise in TC, TG, LDL-C, and a fall in HDL-C. 56
